Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-amino-acid oxidase (LAAO; LAO; snakes, reptils, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family (FIG1 subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (high activity against L-Met, L-Leu, L-Nle, L-Trp, L-Phe and moderate activity against L-Tyr), thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as hemorrhage, hemolysis, edema, antibacterial and antiparasitic activities (By similarity). In addition, this protein induces apoptosis. It also interacts with endothelial cells, and inhibits collagen- and ADP-induced platelet aggregation. L-LAAO family effects on platelets are controversial, since it either induces aggregation or inhibits agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably due to different experimental conditions.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Has parasiticidal activities against both trypanosomes and leishmania, as a result of enzyme-catalyzed hydrogen peroxide production.
Sequence Information.Biophysicochemical properties: pH dependence (Optimum pH is 7.5-8.8 for L-Leu).

Literature.Title: Cytotoxicity and inhibition of platelet aggregation caused by an l-amino acid oxidase from Bothrops leucurus venom.
Literature.Author: Naumann GB, Silva LF, Silva L, Faria G, Richardson M, Evangelista K, Kohlhoff M, Gontijo CM, Navdaev A, de Rezende FF, Eble JA, Sanchez EF.
